chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
g: R -> R
f: R -> R
x: Rbar

Goal:
Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y = g y) -> ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x

Premises:
ex_lim = fun (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar) => exists l : Rbar, is_lim f x l : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
*** [ R : Set ]
Rbar_locally' = fun (a : Rbar) (P : R -> Prop) => match a with | Finite a0 => locally' a0 P | p_infty => exists M : R, forall x : R, M < x -> P x | m_infty => exists M : R, forall x : R, x < M -> P x end : Rbar -> (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
is_lim_ext_loc : forall (f g : R -> R) (x l : Rbar), Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y = g y) -> is_lim f x l -> is_lim g x l
Lim_correct : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> is_lim f x (Lim f x)
is_lim' = fun (f : R -> R) (x l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => Rabs (f y - l0) < eps) | p_infty => forall M : R, Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => M < f y) | m_infty => forall M : R, Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y < M) end : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _ _]
ex_finite_lim_correct : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_finite_lim f x < -> ex_lim f x /\ is_finite (Lim f x)
is_lim_comp' : forall (f0 : ?T -> R) (g0 : R -> R) (x0 l : Rbar), filterlim f0 ?F (Rbar_locally x0) -> is_lim g0 x0 l -> ?F (fun y : ?T => f0 y <> x0) -> filterlim (fun y : ?T => g0 (f0 y)) ?F (Rbar_locally l) where ?T : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_ext_loc : forall f0 g0 : ?T -> ?U, ?F (fun x0 : ?T => f0 x0 = g0 x0) -> filterlim f0 ?F ?G -> filterlim g0 ?F ?G where ?T : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?G : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filter_and : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, ?F P -> ?F Q -> ?F (fun x : ?T => P x /\ Q x) where ?T : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filter_imp : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x -> Q x) -> ?F P -> ?F Q where ?T : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
is_lim_unique : forall (f : R -> R) (x l : Rbar), is_lim f x l -> Lim f x = l
is_lim_comp_seq : forall (f : R -> R) (u : nat -> R) (x l : Rbar), is_lim f x l -> eventually (fun n : nat => u n <> x) -> is_lim_seq u x -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => f (u n)) l
filterlim_comp : forall (T U V : Type) (f : T -> U) (g : U -> V) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) (H : (V -> Prop) -> Prop), filterlim f F G -> filterlim g G H -> filterlim (fun x : T => g (f x)) F H
Rmin = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then x else y : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rmax = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then y else x : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Lim = fun (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar) => Lim_seq (fun n : nat => f (Rbar_loc_seq x n)) : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Rbar Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
locally_interval : forall (P : R -> Prop) (x : R) (a b : Rbar), Rbar_lt a x -> Rbar_lt x b -> (forall y : R, Rbar_lt a y -> Rbar_lt y b -> P y) -> locally x P
ex_finite_lim = fun (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar) => exists l : R, is_lim f x l : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_lim = fun (f : R -> R) (x l : Rbar) => filterlim f (Rbar_locally' x) (Rbar_locally l) : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _ _]
is_Rbar_div = fun x y z : Rbar => is_Rbar_mult x (Rbar_inv y) z : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
FEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> FExpr C -> R
PCond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
Rdiv = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 * / r2 : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rminus = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 + - r2 : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rgt = fun r1 r2 : R => r2 < r1 : R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rle = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 < r2 \/ r1 = r2 : R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
*** [ Rplus : R -> R -> R ] Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
*** [ Rmult : R -> R -> R ] Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rbar_le_lt_trans : forall x y z : Rbar, Rbar_le x y -> Rbar_lt y z -> Rbar_lt x z
minus = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (x y : G) => plus x (opp y) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G -> G -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted

```coq
```coq
intro HL.
apply ex_finite_lim_correct in HL as [HL1 HL2].
destruct HL2 as [l HL3].
rewrite <- is_lim_ext_loc with (g := g) (l := l).
rewrite HL3.
rewrite Lim_correct.
rewrite is_lim_unique.
rewrite is_lim_comp'.
rewrite filterlim_ext_loc.
rewrite filter_and.
rewrite filter_imp.
rewrite filterlim_comp.
rewrite Rmin_spec.
rewrite Rmax_spec.
rewrite Rdiv_spec.
rewrite Rminus_spec.
rewrite Rgt_spec.
rewrite Rle_spec.
rewrite Rbar_le_lt_trans.
rewrite HL1.
Qed.```
